text: So far I've been using the built-in unittest module for unit-testing Python code.
However, for simple cases it seems like an overkill.
Being a derivative of xUnit, it appears a bit heavy for the dynamic nature of Python, where I would expect to write less to achieve the same effects.
On the other hand, it is built-in, makes you write your tests in an organized way, and tested by time.
